title: 103_hr4178
content: The Federal Credit Cost Reduction Act of 1994 amends the treatment of administrative costs for direct and guaranteed loans. It also requires a separate listing of administrative costs in the President's annual budget submission and sets federal credit subsidy rates. The Federal Credit Cost Reduction Act of 1994 sets federal credit subsidy rates for direct loans and loan guarantees, defining subsidy rates and establishing maximum rates. The Federal Credit Cost Reduction Act of 1994 establishes maximum federal credit subsidy rates for covered programs, with rates decreasing over fiscal years 1995 to 1999. The subsidy rates are determined based on estimates by the Director of the Congressional Budget Office. The Federal Credit Cost Reduction Act of 1994 sets maximum federal credit subsidy rates for covered programs, with rates decreasing from 1995 to 1999. Amendments to the Congressional Budget Act of 1974 prohibit breaching the maximum subsidy rate and adjust allocations to prevent breaches. The Congressional Budget Act of 1974 is amended to prevent breaching the maximum subsidy rate for covered programs by adjusting total credit authority allocations. SEC. 5. EFFECTIVE DATE: This Act and its amendments will apply to fiscal years starting after the enactment date.
